headline: Homemade Grain-Free Dog Food
description: Grain free and full of your dog's diet needs, this homemade dog food is an easy alternative to store-bought.
name: Homemade Grain-Free Dog Food

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place carrots, apples, and water into a pot. Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer until soft, 10 to 15 minutes.
Crack eggs and whisk together in a bowl; place eggshells onto a baking sheet.
Bake eggshells in the preheated oven until dry, 5 to 7 minutes.
Remove eggshells from the oven and pulverize using a mortar and pestle or a coffee grinder.

Place ground chicken, chicken livers, eggs, ground eggshells, and sunflower oil into a large skillet. Heat over medium heat, mixing occasionally, until ground chicken is browned and crumbly and livers are no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes.
Place spinach on top of meat mixture in the skillet and cover with a lid to steam until soft, about 5 minutes.
Mash softened carrots and apples using a potato masher and add to meat mixture; mix together.

review.reviewBody: I have a dog just diagnosed with pancreatitis, so I feel the need to make his food now. The vet said 11% fat or lower, so are the nutritional values for dogs? Or humans? My dog weighs 105 lbs so not sure how much he would need?? Thanks so much for taking the time to share this recipe!

My dog is obsessed with this recipe. She is a blue staffordshire terrier and will stand next to me wagging her tail until I feed her. She has much more energy and it seems to be helping her fur hot spots she has developed in her older years. I put just shy of a tablespoon of olive oil and sunflower oil mixed in with each serving. This is what has shown signs of her fur improvement. I would have to say she is a fan of this meal. I am happy to see her happy üòä

When I first started making my dogs food it was because he was being sick from both ends, took him to Dr and he said he is just old! I wasn‚Äôt happy, either way it took Buster at least 2/3 weeks to stop with the diarrhea, but the throwing up stopped sooner! This is a great recipe for your dog, please allow your dog enough time to get all the bad out and let the food in! Can‚Äôt do anything to his system in just 4 days, it took I‚Äôm guessing years to get in his system! I hope this helps. I love my Buster üê©
update on my review. Both my dogs diarrhea'd every time i fed them this food. i made 14 days worth and have 10 days worth of this food left D,:
How much should I feed a 35 lb dog on this recipe? I'd really like to switch to this as I feel like it might help my dog and honestly it sounds like it might be money saving.
Relatively easy and my pup loved it!

Super easy. Made this for my 12year old greyhound/lab as he's growing older I felt I needed to give him a extra kick of nutrition. This recipe makes so much I would recommend this to anyone wanting to try to make thier own dog food.
